explanation: to make a bad situation worse
sentence: Attempts to restrict parking in the city centre have further aggravated the problem of traffic congestion.
sentence_gap: Attempts to restrict parking in the city centre have further __________ the problem of traffic congestion.

explanation: formal; to describe or mark the edge of something
sentence: The main characters are clearly delineated in the first chapter. The boundary of the car park is delineated by a low brick wall.
sentence_gap: The main characters are clearly __________ in the first chapter. The boundary of the car park is __________ by a low brick wall.

explanation: an area of water in a port that can be closed off and that is used for putting goods onto and taking them off ships or repairing ships
sentence: The ship sailed into the dock to be refitted.
sentence_gap: The ship sailed into the ____ to be refitted.

sentence: Dad will be livid when he finds out.
sentence_gap: Dad will be _____ when he finds out.

explanation: not being careful or giving enough attention to people or things that are your responsibility
sentence: The judge said that the teacher had been negligent in allowing the children to swim in dangerous water.
sentence_gap: The judge said that the teacher had been _________ in allowing the children to swim in dangerous water.

explanation: (especially of children) showing mental development or achievement much earlier than usual
sentence: A precocious child, she went to university at the age of 15.
sentence_gap: A __________ child, she went to university at the age of 15.

explanation: to be built or formed, or to happen, at an earlier date than something else in the past
sentence: These cave paintings predate any others which are known.
sentence_gap: These cave paintings _______ any others which are known.

explanation: to make a long, loud, deep sound
sentence: We could hear the lions roaring at the other end of the zoo.
sentence_gap: We could hear the lions _______ at the other end of the zoo.

explanation: to kill someone by covering their face so that they cannot breathe
sentence: He smothered the baby with a pillow.
sentence_gap: He _________ the baby with a pillow.

explanation: (of a flag, sail, etc.) to become open from a rolled position, or to cause something to become open from a rolled position
sentence: The demonstrators unfurled a large banner.
